venue.address_1: Mt. Auburn Street opposite Willard Street
venue.name: Mt. Auburn Street opposite Willard Street- Park

item.description:
Spring is a great time to learn about urban wild food.

We'll walk along the Charles River and identify edible and medicinal weeds, plus juneberry and mulberry trees.

Focus will be on learning the characteristics of each plant so you will be able to identify them on your own.

We'll also talk about ways to prepare food, tea, and remedies.

Meeting location is a park formed by the triangle of Memorial Drive and Mt. Auburn Street across from Longfellow Park.  We'll meet at the corner of the park opposite Willard Street.  The place is walkable from Harvard Square and is on the #71 and #73 bus routes.

No preregistration required.  $15 fee.

Facilitated by Jules Kobek, an avid forager and co-founder of DIO (Do-It-Ourselves) Skillshare, which teaches skills on urban homesteading and sustainability.  Jules has taught or co-taught classes through the Boston Natural Areas Network (BNAN), Boston Skillshare, Cambridge Center for Adult Education and the Urban Homesteaders League.
item.name: Identify Edible and Medicinal Weeds
